content:
Diagnosis:
Clear cell carcinoma of ovary, Stage IC2 (capsule rupture during surgery)

Surgery:
15 March 2024 - Total abdominal hysterectomy, bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy, omentectomy and peritoneal biopsies

Histology:
Clear cell carcinoma of right ovary
ARID1A mutation detected
HNF1B positive
No lymphovascular invasion
No surface involvement
Capsule rupture during surgery

Previous medical history:
Hypertension
Type 2 diabetes

Current medications:
Metformin 1g BD
Ramipril 5mg OD

Allergies:
None known

Current situation:
Seen for discussion regarding adjuvant chemotherapy

I reviewed [redacted name] today following her recent surgery. She has recovered well with good wound healing and no post-operative complications. Her performance status is 0 and she has returned to most normal activities. Blood results show normal renal and liver function. CA125 has normalized to 22 (pre-operative value 156).

I have discussed the role of adjuvant chemotherapy given the clear cell histology and stage IC2 disease. The plan is to proceed with 6 cycles of carboplatin and paclitaxel chemotherapy. I have explained the common and serious side effects, and provided written information. We will arrange baseline investigations including CT chest/abdomen/pelvis and echocardiogram before starting treatment.

Plan to commence chemotherapy in 2 weeks pending investigation results. Will review in clinic prior to cycle 1.

primary_cancer.histopathology_status: Clear cell carcinoma, no lymphovascular invasion, capsule rupture during surgery

cancer_timeline.value: Total abdominal hysterectomy, bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy, omentectomy and peritoneal biopsies

status_updates.value: Stage IC2 clear cell ovarian cancer post-surgery. Good post-operative recovery with normalized tumor markers.
Recovered well from surgery with no post-operative complications
Arranging baseline CT chest/abdomen/pelvis and echocardiogram
Review in clinic prior to cycle 1 chemotherapy
